info.title: Microfox Slack API
info.description: Single entry-point API for all Microfox Slack functions via a wrapper Lambda

post.summary: Send a message to a Slack channel
post.description: The chat.postMessage function allows sending a message to a specified Slack channel, private group, or IM channel. It supports various customization options including text formatting, attachments, blocks, and metadata. The function can be used to send simple text messages or create more interactive and rich content.

body.description: Body of the chat.postMessage sls call

items.description: Message configuration object

channel.description: Channel, private group, or IM channel ID to send message to. Can be an encoded ID, or a channel name.

text.description: The formatted text of the message to be published. If blocks are included, this will be used as fallback text for notifications.

attachments.description: A JSON-based array of structured attachments, presented as a URL-encoded string.

blocks.description: A JSON-based array of structured blocks, presented as a URL-encoded string.

as_user.description: Pass true to post the message as the authed user, instead of as a bot. Defaults to false.

icon_emoji.description: Emoji to use as the icon for this message. Overrides icon_url.

icon_url.description: URL to an image to use as the icon for this message.

mrkdwn.description: Disable Slack markup parsing by setting to false. Enabled by default.

metadata.description: JSON object with event_type and event_payload fields, presented as a URL-encoded string.

parse.description: Change how messages are treated. Defaults to none.

reply_broadcast.description: Used in conjunction with thread_ts and indicates whether reply should be made visible to everyone in the channel or conversation. Defaults to false.

thread_ts.description: The ts value of another message to reply to.

unfurl_links.description: Pass true to enable unfurling of primarily text-based content.

unfurl_media.description: Pass false to disable unfurling of media content.

constructorName.description: Name of the constructor to use.

ok.description: true if the request was successful

channel.description: The ID of the channel where the message was posted

message.description: An object containing the details of the sent message

error.description: Error code

post.summary: Updates an existing message in a Slack channel.
post.description: The chat.update method allows you to modify an existing message in a Slack channel. This is particularly useful for updating the status of long-running tasks or providing progressive information to users. The method supports updating the message text, adding structured blocks or attachments, and can be used with various options to control the message's appearance and behavior.

body.description: Body of the chat.update sls call

items.description: Configuration object containing all function parameters

channel.description: The ID of the conversation to update the message in.

ts.description: The timestamp of the message to be updated.

text.description: The new text for the message. Required if blocks and attachments are not provided.

attachments.description: A JSON-based array of structured attachments.

as_user.description: Pass true to update the message as the authed user. Bot users are considered authed users.

link_names.description: Find and link channel names and usernames.

parse.description: Change how messages are treated. Defaults to client. Can be none or full.

metadata.description: A JSON object with event_type and event_payload fields.

constructorName.description: Name of the constructor to use.

ok.description: true if the request was successful.

channel.description: The ID of the channel where the message was posted.

text.description: The new text of the message.

message.description: An object containing the details of the sent message.

post.summary: Fetches a conversation's history of messages and events.
post.description: The conversations.history method retrieves the message and event history for a specified conversation (channel). It allows for pagination and filtering of results based on timestamps, and can include additional metadata. This method is useful for analyzing conversation history, auditing, or displaying chat logs.

body.description: Body of the conversations.history sls call

items.description: Configuration object containing all function parameters

channel.description: Conversation ID to fetch history for.

cursor.description: Paginate through collections of data by setting the cursor parameter to a next_cursor attribute returned by a previous request.

include_all_metadata.description: Return all metadata associated with this message. Default false.

inclusive.description: Include messages with oldest or latest timestamps in results. Ignored unless either timestamp is specified.

latest.description: Only messages before this Unix timestamp will be included in results.

limit.description: The maximum number of items to return.

oldest.description: Only messages after this Unix timestamp will be included in results.

constructorName.description: Name of the constructor to use.

ok.description: true if the request was successful.

user.description: The ID of the user who sent the message.

has_more.description: true if there are more messages to retrieve.

pin_count.description: The number of pinned messages in the channel.

post.summary: Join an existing public channel in Slack.
post.description: The conversations.join method allows a user or bot to join an existing public channel in a Slack workspace. This is essential for bots that need to be active in specific channels. The method requires the ID of the channel to join and returns details about the joined conversation.

body.description: Body of the conversations.join sls call

channel.description: The ID of the conversation to join.

items.description: Configuration object containing the channel ID

constructorName.description: Name of the constructor to use.

ok.description: Indicates if the operation was successful

name.description: The name of the channel-like thing

is_channel.description: Indicates whether a conversation is a channel

is_group.description: Means the channel is a private channel created before March 2021

is_im.description: Means the conversation is a direct message between two distinguished individuals or a user and a bot

is_mpim.description: Represents an unnamed private conversation between multiple users

is_private.description: Means the conversation is privileged between two or more members

created.description: Timestamp of when the conversation was created

creator.description: The ID of the member that created this conversation

is_general.description: Means the channel is the workspace's 'general' discussion channel

unlinked.description: The number of members that have been removed from the channel

name_normalized.description: The channel name, but with any special characters replaced

is_shared.description: Indicates whether a conversation is part of a Shared Channel

is_ext_shared.description: Indicates whether a conversation is part of a Shared Channel with a remote organization

is_org_shared.description: Indicates whether this shared channel is shared between Enterprise Grid workspaces within the same organization

pending_shared.description: A list of team IDs that have been invited to the channel but have not yet joined

is_pending_ext_shared.description: Means the conversation is ready to become an is_ext_shared channel, but needs some kind of approval or sign off first

is_member.description: Indicates whether the user, bot user or Slack app is a member of the conversation

topic.description: Provides information about the channel topic

purpose.description: Provides information about the channel purpose

previous_names.description: A list of previous names for the channel

num_members.description: The number of members in the conversation

ok.description: Indicates the request was unsuccessful

error.description: Error code explaining the reason for the failure

ok.description: Indicates the request was unsuccessful

error.description: Error code indicating rate limiting

ok.description: Indicates the request was unsuccessful

error.description: Error code indicating a server-side issue

ok.description: Indicates the request was unsuccessful

error.description: Error code indicating the service is temporarily unavailable

post.summary: Retrieves a list of conversations (channels, private channels, DMs, and MPDMs) in a Slack workspace.
post.description: The conversations.list method allows you to fetch a list of conversations in a Slack workspace. It supports pagination and filtering options to customize the results. The method returns detailed information about each conversation, including its type, members, and various attributes.

body.description: Body of the conversations.list sls call

items.description: Parameters for filtering and paginating conversation results

cursor.description: Paginate through collections of data by setting the cursor parameter to a next_cursor attribute returned by a previous request.

exclude_archived.description: Set to true to exclude archived channels from the list. Default is false.

limit.description: The maximum number of items to return. Must be an integer under 1000. Default is 100.

types.description: A comma-separated list of conversation types to include. Types can be public_channel, private_channel, mpim, and im. Default is public_channel.

constructorName.description: Name of the constructor to use.

200.description: Successful response with a list of conversations

ok.description: Indicates if the request was successful

name.description: The name of the channel-like thing

is_channel.description: Indicates whether a conversation is a channel

is_group.description: Means the channel is a private channel created before March 2021

is_im.description: Means the conversation is a direct message between two distinguished individuals or a user and a bot

is_mpim.description: Represents an unnamed private conversation between multiple users

is_private.description: Means the conversation is privileged between two or more members

created.description: Timestamp of when the conversation was created

creator.description: The ID of the member that created this conversation

is_general.description: Means the channel is the workspace's "general" discussion channel

unlinked.description: The number of members that have been removed from the channel

name_normalized.description: The channel name, but with any special characters replaced

is_shared.description: Indicates whether a conversation is part of a Shared Channel

is_ext_shared.description: Indicates whether a conversation is part of a Shared Channel with a remote organization

is_org_shared.description: Indicates whether this shared channel is shared between Enterprise Grid workspaces within the same organization

pending_shared.description: A list of team IDs that have been invited to the channel but have not yet joined

is_pending_ext_shared.description: Means the conversation is ready to become an is_ext_shared channel, but needs some kind of approval or sign off first

is_member.description: Indicates whether the user, bot user or Slack app is a member of the conversation

topic.description: Provides information about the channel topic

purpose.description: Provides information about the channel purpose

previous_names.description: A list of previous names for the channel

num_members.description: The number of members in the conversation

post.summary: Adds a reaction (emoji) to a message in a Slack channel.
post.description: The reactions.add function allows users to add an emoji reaction to a specific message in a Slack channel. It requires the channel ID, the timestamp of the message, and the name of the reaction (emoji) to be added. This function is useful for providing quick, non-verbal feedback or responses to messages in Slack conversations.

body.description: Body of the reactions.add sls call

items.description: Configuration object containing all function parameters

channel.description: Channel where the message to add reaction to was posted

timestamp.description: Timestamp of the message to add reaction to

constructorName.description: Name of the constructor to use.

ok.description: Indicates if the operation was successful

error.description: Error code

post.summary: Retrieves detailed information about a specific Slack user.
post.description: The users.info method fetches comprehensive details about a user in a Slack workspace. It returns a user object containing various attributes such as user ID, name, team information, profile details, and user permissions. This method is useful for obtaining up-to-date information about a user's status, roles, and profile data.

body.description: Body of the users.info sls call

user.description: User ID to receive information about.

include_locale.description: Set to true to receive the locale for this user. Defaults to false.

constructorName.description: Name of the constructor to use.

ok.description: Indicates if the request was successful

team_id.description: The ID of the team the user belongs to

deleted.description: True if the user has been deleted

color.description: A hexadecimal color code that is used to color the user's name in Slack clients

tz_label.description: A human-readable string for the user's timezone

tz_offset.description: The user's timezone offset in seconds

profile.description: A profile object containing more details about the user

avatar_hash.description: A hash of the user's avatar image

image_original.description: The URL of the user's original-sized profile image

image_24.description: The URL of the user's 24x24 profile image

image_32.description: The URL of the user's 32x32 profile image

image_48.description: The URL of the user's 48x48 profile image

image_72.description: The URL of the user's 72x72 profile image

image_192.description: The URL of the user's 192x192 profile image

image_512.description: The URL of the user's 512x512 profile image

team.description: The ID of the team the user belongs to

is_admin.description: True if the user is an admin

is_owner.description: True if the user is an owner

is_primary_owner.description: True if the user is the primary owner

is_restricted.description: True if the user is a restricted user (single-channel guest)

is_ultra_restricted.description: True if the user is an ultra-restricted user (multi-channel guest)

is_bot.description: True if the user is a bot

updated.description: A timestamp of when the user's profile was last updated

is_app_user.description: True if the user is an app user

has_2fa.description: True if the user has two-factor authentication enabled

post.summary: Retrieves a list of all users in a Slack team.
post.description: The users.list method returns a comprehensive list of all users in a Slack team, including their profile information and various attributes. It supports pagination and allows filtering by team ID when using an org token. This method is useful for obtaining detailed information about team members and their roles within the Slack workspace.

body.description: Body of the users.list sls call

cursor.description: Paginate through collections of data by setting the cursor parameter to a next_cursor attribute returned by a previous request.

include_locale.description: Set this to true to receive the locale for users. Defaults to false.

limit.description: The maximum number of items to return. Fewer than the requested number of items may be returned, even if the end of the users list hasn't been reached.

team_id.description: Encoded team id to list users in, required if org token is used.

constructorName.description: Name of the constructor to use.

ok.description: true if the request was successful.

team_id.description: The ID of the team the user belongs to.

deleted.description: true if the user has been deleted.

color.description: A hexadecimal color code that is used to color the user's name in Slack clients.

tz_label.description: A human-readable string for the user's timezone.

tz_offset.description: The user's timezone offset in seconds.

profile.description: A profile object containing more details about the user.

avatar_hash.description: A hash of the user's avatar image.

image_original.description: The URL of the user's original-sized profile image.

image_24.description: The URL of the user's 24x24 profile image.

image_32.description: The URL of the user's 32x32 profile image.

image_48.description: The URL of the user's 48x48 profile image.

image_72.description: The URL of the user's 72x72 profile image.

image_192.description: The URL of the user's 192x192 profile image.

image_512.description: The URL of the user's 512x512 profile image.

team.description: The ID of the team the user belongs to.

is_admin.description: true if the user is an admin.

is_owner.description: true if the user is an owner.

is_primary_owner.description: true if the user is the primary owner.

is_restricted.description: true if the user is a restricted user (single-channel guest).

is_ultra_restricted.description: true if the user is an ultra-restricted user (multi-channel guest).

is_bot.description: true if the user is a bot.

updated.description: A timestamp of when the user's profile was last updated.

is_app_user.description: true if the user is an app user.

has_2fa.description: true if the user has two-factor authentication enabled.

cache_ts.description: A timestamp of when the user list was cached.

post.summary: Finds a user by their email address in a Slack workspace.
post.description: The users.lookupByEmail method allows you to find a user in a Slack workspace using their email address. This is particularly useful for integrations where you have a user's email but not their Slack ID. The method returns detailed information about the user if found.

body.description: Body of the users.lookupByEmail sls call

email.description: An email address belonging to a user in the workspace.

constructorName.description: Name of the constructor to use.

ok.description: Indicates if the request was successful

team_id.description: The ID of the team the user belongs to

deleted.description: true if the user has been deleted

color.description: A hexadecimal color code for the user's name in Slack clients

tz_label.description: A human-readable string for the user's timezone

tz_offset.description: The user's timezone offset in seconds

avatar_hash.description: A hash of the user's avatar image

image_original.description: The URL of the user's original-sized profile image

image_24.description: The URL of the user's 24x24 profile image

image_32.description: The URL of the user's 32x32 profile image

image_48.description: The URL of the user's 48x48 profile image

image_72.description: The URL of the user's 72x72 profile image

image_192.description: The URL of the user's 192x192 profile image

image_512.description: The URL of the user's 512x512 profile image

team.description: The ID of the team the user belongs to

is_admin.description: true if the user is an admin

is_owner.description: true if the user is an owner

is_primary_owner.description: true if the user is the primary owner

is_restricted.description: true if the user is a restricted user

is_ultra_restricted.description: true if the user is an ultra-restricted user

is_bot.description: true if the user is a bot

updated.description: A timestamp of when the user's profile was last updated

is_app_user.description: true if the user is an app user

has_2fa.description: true if the user has two-factor authentication enabled

post.summary: Opens a modal view for a user in Slack.
post.description: The views.open method opens a modal for a user in Slack. It requires a trigger_id obtained from a user interaction and a view payload defining the modal's content and behavior. This method allows for creating interactive surfaces for various purposes such as forms, alerts, and more.

body.description: Body of the views.open sls call

trigger_id.description: A short-lived token received after a user interaction, used to open the modal.

view.description: A view payload defining the modal's content and behavior.

type.description: The type of view. Must be 'modal' for modals.

title.description: The title that appears in the top-left of the modal.

text.description: The text content of the title.

submit.description: Defines the text displayed in the submit button.

type.description: Must be 'plain_text' for the submit button.

text.description: The text content of the submit button.

blocks.description: An array of blocks that defines the content of the view.

items.description: A block object defining part of the modal's content.

private_metadata.description: A string that will be sent to your app in view_submission and block_actions events.

callback_id.description: An identifier to recognize interactions and submissions of this particular view.

external_id.description: A custom identifier that must be unique for all views on a per-team basis.

clear_on_close.description: When set to true, clicking on the close button will clear all views in a modal and close it.

notify_on_close.description: Indicates whether Slack will send your request URL a view_closed event when a user clicks the close button.

constructorName.description: Name of the constructor to use.

ok.description: Indicates whether the call was successful.

view.description: The view object representing the opened modal.

id.description: The unique identifier for the view.

team_id.description: The ID of the team that the view belongs to.

type.description: The type of view. Set to 'modal' for modals.

title.description: The title that appears in the top-left of the modal.

blocks.description: An array of blocks that defines the content of the view.

private_metadata.description: A string that will be sent to your app in view_submission and block_actions events.

callback_id.description: An identifier to recognize interactions and submissions of this particular view.

external_id.description: A custom identifier that must be unique for all views on a per-team basis.

state.description: An object that contains the state of any interactive components in the view.

hash.description: A unique value that is used to ensure that the correct view is being updated.

clear_on_close.description: Indicates whether clicking on the close button will clear all views in a modal and close it.

notify_on_close.description: Indicates whether Slack will send your request URL a view_closed event when a user clicks the close button.

root_view_id.description: The ID of the root view.

app_id.description: The ID of the app that created the view.

bot_id.description: The ID of the bot user that created the view.

ok.description: Indicates that the request was unsuccessful.

error.description: A string describing the error.

ok.description: Indicates that the request was unsuccessful.

error.description: A string describing the authentication error.

ok.description: Indicates that the request was unsuccessful.

error.description: A string indicating that the request was rate limited.

ok.description: Indicates that the request was unsuccessful.

error.description: A string describing the server error.

ok.description: Indicates that the request was unsuccessful.

error.description: A string indicating that the service is temporarily unavailable.

post.summary: Lists all public and private channels in a Slack workspace.
post.description: The listChannels function retrieves information about all channel-like conversations in a Slack workspace, including public channels, private channels, direct messages, and multi-person direct messages. It returns an array of conversation objects, each containing detailed information about a specific channel or conversation.

body.description: Body of the listChannels sls call

constructorName.description: Name of the constructor to use.

name.description: The name of the channel-like thing, without a leading hash sign.

is_channel.description: Indicates whether a conversation is a channel.

is_group.description: Means the channel is a private channel created before March 2021.

is_im.description: Means the conversation is a direct message between two distinguished individuals or a user and a bot.

is_mpim.description: Represents an unnamed private conversation between multiple users.

is_private.description: Means the conversation is privileged between two or more members.

created.description: Timestamp of when the conversation was created.

creator.description: The ID of the member that created this conversation.

is_archived.description: Indicates a conversation is archived, frozen in time.

is_general.description: Means the channel is the workspace's "general" discussion channel.

name_normalized.description: The "normalized" name of a channel, which may be different from `name` due to legacy naming rules.

is_shared.description: Means the conversation is in some way shared between multiple workspaces.

is_frozen.description: Indicates that the channel is frozen.

is_org_shared.description: Indicates whether this shared channel is shared between Enterprise Grid workspaces within the same organization.

is_pending_ext_shared.description: Means the conversation is ready to become an `is_ext_shared` channel, but needs some kind of approval or sign off first.

pending_shared.description: A list of team IDs that have been invited to the channel but have not yet joined.

context_team_id.description: The team ID of the team that this channel belongs to.

updated.description: The timestamp, in milliseconds, when the channel settings were updated.

parent_conversation.description: The ID of the parent conversation. This is present for threaded messages.

is_ext_shared.description: Indicates whether a conversation is part of a Shared Channel with a remote organization.

shared_team_ids.description: A list of team IDs that are part of this shared channel.

pending_connected_team_ids.description: A list of team IDs that have been invited to connect to the channel but have not yet accepted.

is_member.description: Indicates whether the user, bot user or Slack app associated with the token making the API call is itself a member of the conversation.

topic.description: Provides information about the channel topic.

purpose.description: Provides information about the channel purpose.

previous_names.description: A list of previous names for the channel.

num_members.description: The number of members in the conversation. This field is only present if `include_num_members` is true in the request.

locale.description: The locale for this conversation. This field is only present if `include_locale` is true in the request.

last_read.description: The timestamp for the last message the calling user has read in this channel.

latest.description: The latest message in the channel.

unread_count.description: A full count of visible messages that the calling user has yet to read.

unread_count_display.description: A count of messages that the calling user has yet to read that matter to them.

400.description: Bad Request - The request was invalid or cannot be served.

401.description: Unauthorized - The request requires user authentication.

403.description: Forbidden - The server understood the request but refuses to authorize it.

429.description: Too Many Requests - The user has sent too many requests in a given amount of time.

500.description: Internal Server Error - The server has encountered a situation it does not know how to handle.

post.summary: Retrieves detailed information about a specific Slack channel.
post.description: The getChannelConversationInfo function fetches comprehensive data about a specified Slack channel, including its properties, settings, and metadata. It provides insights into the channel's type, membership, sharing status, and other relevant attributes, allowing developers to access and utilize channel-specific information within their Slack integrations.

body.description: Body of the getChannelConversationInfo sls call

items.description: The ID of the channel to get information about.

constructorName.description: Name of the constructor to use.

200.description: Successful response with channel conversation information

name.description: The name of the channel-like thing, without a leading hash sign.

is_channel.description: Indicates whether a conversation is a channel.

is_group.description: Means the channel is a private channel created before March 2021.

is_im.description: Means the conversation is a direct message between two distinguished individuals or a user and a bot.

is_mpim.description: Represents an unnamed private conversation between multiple users.

is_private.description: Means the conversation is privileged between two or more members.

created.description: Timestamp of when the conversation was created.

creator.description: The ID of the member that created this conversation.

is_archived.description: Indicates a conversation is archived, frozen in time.

is_general.description: Means the channel is the workspace's "general" discussion channel.

name_normalized.description: The "normalized" name of a channel, which may be different from `name` due to legacy naming rules.

is_shared.description: Means the conversation is in some way shared between multiple workspaces.

is_frozen.description: Indicates that the channel is frozen.

is_org_shared.description: Indicates whether this shared channel is shared between Enterprise Grid workspaces within the same organization.

is_pending_ext_shared.description: Means the conversation is ready to become an `is_ext_shared` channel, but needs some kind of approval or sign off first.

pending_shared.description: A list of team IDs that have been invited to the channel but have not yet joined.

context_team_id.description: The team ID of the team that this channel belongs to.

updated.description: The timestamp, in milliseconds, when the channel settings were updated.

parent_conversation.description: The ID of the parent conversation. This is present for threaded messages.

is_ext_shared.description: Indicates whether a conversation is part of a Shared Channel with a remote organization.

shared_team_ids.description: A list of team IDs that are part of this shared channel.

pending_connected_team_ids.description: A list of team IDs that have been invited to connect to the channel but have not yet accepted.

is_member.description: Indicates whether the user, bot user or Slack app associated with the token making the API call is itself a member of the conversation.

topic.description: Provides information about the channel topic.

purpose.description: Provides information about the channel purpose.

previous_names.description: A list of previous names for the channel.

num_members.description: The number of members in the conversation. This field is only present if `include_num_members` is true in the request.

locale.description: The locale for this conversation. This field is only present if `include_locale` is true in the request.

last_read.description: The timestamp for the last message the calling user has read in this channel.

latest.description: The latest message in the channel.

unread_count.description: A full count of visible messages that the calling user has yet to read.

unread_count_display.description: A count of messages that the calling user has yet to read that matter to them.

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid channel ID or other client error

404.description: Not Found - Channel does not exist or user doesn't have access

post.summary: Lists all users in a Slack workspace.
post.description: The listUsers function retrieves information about all users in a Slack workspace. It returns an array of user objects, each containing detailed information about a workspace user including their profile, permissions, and various attributes. This function does not require any input parameters.

body.description: Body of the listUsers sls call

constructorName.description: Name of the constructor to use.

id.description: Identifier for this workspace user. It is unique to the workspace containing the user.

team_id.description: The ID of the team the user belongs to.

deleted.description: Indicates if the user has been deactivated.

color.description: Used in some clients to display a special username color.

real_name.description: The user's first and last name.

tz.description: A human-readable string for the geographic timezone-related region this user has specified in their account.

tz_label.description: Describes the commonly used name of the tz timezone.

tz_offset.description: Indicates the number of seconds to offset UTC time by for this user's tz.

profile.description: The profile object contains the default fields of a user's workspace profile.

phone.description: The user's phone number, in any format.

real_name.description: The user's first and last name.

real_name_normalized.description: The real_name field, but with any non-Latin characters filtered out.

display_name.description: The display name the user has chosen to identify themselves by in their workspace profile.

display_name_normalized.description: The display_name field, but with any non-Latin characters filtered out.

fields.description: All the custom profile fields for the user.

status_text.description: The displayed text of up to 100 characters.

status_emoji.description: The displayed emoji that is enabled for the Slack team, such as :train:.

status_expiration.description: The Unix timestamp of when the status will expire.

avatar_hash.description: A hash of the user's avatar.

start_date.description: The date the person joined the organization.

image_original.description: URL to the original size of the user's profile picture.

is_custom_image.description: Indicates if the user has a custom profile picture.

email.description: A valid email address. Requires users:read.email scope.

pronouns.description: The pronouns the user prefers to be addressed by.

image_24.description: URL to a 24x24 pixel version of the user's profile picture.

image_32.description: URL to a 32x32 pixel version of the user's profile picture.

image_48.description: URL to a 48x48 pixel version of the user's profile picture.

image_72.description: URL to a 72x72 pixel version of the user's profile picture.

image_192.description: URL to a 192x192 pixel version of the user's profile picture.

image_512.description: URL to a 512x512 pixel version of the user's profile picture.

image_1024.description: URL to a 1024x1024 pixel version of the user's profile picture.

team.description: The ID of the team the user is on.

is_admin.description: Indicates whether the user is an Admin of the current workspace.

is_owner.description: Indicates whether the user is an Owner of the current workspace.

is_primary_owner.description: Indicates whether the user is the Primary Owner of the current workspace.

is_restricted.description: Indicates whether or not the user is a guest user.

is_ultra_restricted.description: Indicates whether or not the user is a single-channel guest.

is_bot.description: Indicates whether the user is a bot user.

is_app_user.description: Indicates whether the user is an authorized user of the calling app.

updated.description: A Unix timestamp indicating when the user object was last updated.

is_email_confirmed.description: Indicates if the user's email address has been confirmed.

who_can_share_contact_card.description: Who can share the user's contact card.

enterprise_user.description: An object containing info related to an Enterprise Grid user.

400.description: Bad Request - The request was invalid or cannot be served.

error.description: Error message describing the issue with the request.

401.description: Unauthorized - Authentication failed or user doesn't have permissions for the requested operation.

error.description: Error message indicating authentication failure or lack of permissions.

429.description: Too Many Requests - Request rate limit exceeded.

error.description: Error message indicating rate limit exceeded.

500.description: Internal Server Error - The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

error.description: Error message describing the server error.

post.summary: Lists all users in a specific Slack channel.
post.description: The listChannelUsers function retrieves a list of all user IDs for members of a specified Slack channel. It takes a single parameter, the channel ID, and returns an array of user IDs. This function is useful for obtaining information about channel membership and can be used for various channel management tasks.

body.description: Body of the listChannelUsers sls call

items.description: The ID of the channel to get the members of.

constructorName.description: Name of the constructor to use.

items.description: User ID

schema.description: An array of user IDs representing the members of the channel

400.description: Bad Request - Invalid channel ID format

error.description: Error message

403.description: Forbidden - Bot does not have permission to access the channel

error.description: Error message

404.description: Not Found - Channel does not exist

error.description: Error message
Error message

post.summary: Search for a Slack user by their email address.
post.description: The searchUser function finds a user in a Slack workspace using their email address. It returns a detailed user object containing information about the user, including their profile, permissions, and various attributes. This function is useful for retrieving user information programmatically within a Slack integration or bot.

body.description: Body of the searchUser sls call

items.description: The email address of the user to find.

constructorName.description: Name of the constructor to use.

id.description: Identifier for this workspace user. It is unique to the workspace containing the user.

team_id.description: The ID of the team the user belongs to.

deleted.description: Indicates if the user has been deactivated.

color.description: Used in some clients to display a special username color.

real_name.description: The user's first and last name.

tz.description: A human-readable string for the geographic timezone-related region this user has specified in their account.

tz_label.description: Describes the commonly used name of the tz timezone.

tz_offset.description: Indicates the number of seconds to offset UTC time by for this user's tz.

profile.description: The profile object contains the default fields of a user's workspace profile.

phone.description: The user's phone number, in any format.

real_name.description: The user's first and last name.

real_name_normalized.description: The real_name field, but with any non-Latin characters filtered out.

display_name.description: The display name the user has chosen to identify themselves by in their workspace profile.

display_name_normalized.description: The display_name field, but with any non-Latin characters filtered out.

fields.description: All the custom profile fields for the user.

status_text.description: The displayed text of up to 100 characters.

status_emoji.description: The displayed emoji that is enabled for the Slack team, such as :train:.

status_expiration.description: The Unix timestamp of when the status will expire.

avatar_hash.description: A hash of the user's avatar.

start_date.description: The date the person joined the organization.

image_original.description: URL to the original size of the user's profile picture.

is_custom_image.description: Indicates if the user has a custom profile picture.

email.description: A valid email address. Requires users:read.email scope.

pronouns.description: The pronouns the user prefers to be addressed by.

image_24.description: URL to a 24x24 pixel version of the user's profile picture.

image_32.description: URL to a 32x32 pixel version of the user's profile picture.

image_48.description: URL to a 48x48 pixel version of the user's profile picture.

image_72.description: URL to a 72x72 pixel version of the user's profile picture.

image_192.description: URL to a 192x192 pixel version of the user's profile picture.

image_512.description: URL to a 512x512 pixel version of the user's profile picture.

image_1024.description: URL to a 1024x1024 pixel version of the user's profile picture.

team.description: The ID of the team the user is on.

is_admin.description: Indicates whether the user is an Admin of the current workspace.

is_owner.description: Indicates whether the user is an Owner of the current workspace.

is_primary_owner.description: Indicates whether the user is the Primary Owner of the current workspace.

is_restricted.description: Indicates whether or not the user is a guest user.

is_ultra_restricted.description: Indicates whether or not the user is a single-channel guest.

is_bot.description: Indicates whether the user is a bot user.

is_app_user.description: Indicates whether the user is an authorized user of the calling app.

updated.description: A Unix timestamp indicating when the user object was last updated.

is_email_confirmed.description: Indicates if the user's email address has been confirmed.

who_can_share_contact_card.description: Who can share the user's contact card.

enterprise_user.description: An object containing info related to an Enterprise Grid user.

400.description: Bad Request - The server cannot process the request due to a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

error.description: Error message describing the issue with the request.

404.description: Not Found - The requested user was not found.

error.description: Error message indicating that the user was not found.

500.description: Internal Server Error - The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

error.description: Error message describing the server error.

post.summary: Searches for a Slack channel by its name.
post.description: The searchChannel function finds a Slack channel by its name, performing a case-insensitive search. It returns a detailed conversation object if the channel is found, or undefined if no matching channel is located. This function is useful for retrieving comprehensive information about a specific Slack channel within a workspace.

body.description: Body of the searchChannel sls call

items.description: The name of the channel to find (case-insensitive).

constructorName.description: Name of the constructor to use.

name.description: The name of the channel-like thing, without a leading hash sign.

is_channel.description: Indicates whether a conversation is a channel.

is_group.description: Means the channel is a private channel created before March 2021.

is_im.description: Means the conversation is a direct message between two distinguished individuals or a user and a bot.

is_mpim.description: Represents an unnamed private conversation between multiple users.

is_private.description: Means the conversation is privileged between two or more members.

created.description: Timestamp of when the conversation was created.

creator.description: The ID of the member that created this conversation.

is_archived.description: Indicates a conversation is archived, frozen in time.

is_general.description: Means the channel is the workspace's "general" discussion channel.

name_normalized.description: The "normalized" name of a channel, which may be different from `name` due to legacy naming rules.

is_shared.description: Means the conversation is in some way shared between multiple workspaces.

is_frozen.description: Indicates that the channel is frozen.

is_org_shared.description: Indicates whether this shared channel is shared between Enterprise Grid workspaces within the same organization.

is_pending_ext_shared.description: Means the conversation is ready to become an `is_ext_shared` channel, but needs some kind of approval or sign off first.

pending_shared.description: A list of team IDs that have been invited to the channel but have not yet joined.

context_team_id.description: The team ID of the team that this channel belongs to.

updated.description: The timestamp, in milliseconds, when the channel settings were updated.

parent_conversation.description: The ID of the parent conversation. This is present for threaded messages.

is_ext_shared.description: Indicates whether a conversation is part of a Shared Channel with a remote organization.

shared_team_ids.description: A list of team IDs that are part of this shared channel.

pending_connected_team_ids.description: A list of team IDs that have been invited to connect to the channel but have not yet accepted.

is_member.description: Indicates whether the user, bot user or Slack app associated with the token making the API call is itself a member of the conversation.

topic.description: Provides information about the channel topic.

purpose.description: Provides information about the channel purpose.

previous_names.description: A list of previous names for the channel.

num_members.description: The number of members in the conversation. This field is only present if `include_num_members` is true in the request.

locale.description: The locale for this conversation. This field is only present if `include_locale` is true in the request.

last_read.description: The timestamp for the last message the calling user has read in this channel.

latest.description: The latest message in the channel.

unread_count.description: A full count of visible messages that the calling user has yet to read.

unread_count_display.description: A count of messages that the calling user has yet to read that matter to them.

400.description: Bad Request - The server cannot process the request due to a client error.

404.description: Not Found - The requested channel was not found.

500.description: Internal Server Error - The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

post.summary: Send a direct message to a Slack user.
post.description: The messageUser function allows sending a direct message to a specified Slack user using their user ID. It provides a simple way to programmatically send messages to individual users in a Slack workspace. The function returns details about the sent message, including its timestamp and the channel where it was posted.

body.description: Body of the messageUser sls call

items.name: userId
items.description: The ID of the user to send the message to.

items.name: text
items.description: The text of the message.

constructorName.description: Name of the constructor to use.

ok.description: true if the request was successful.

channel.description: The ID of the channel where the message was posted.

message.description: An object containing the details of the sent message.

bot_id.description: The ID of the bot that sent the message.

username.description: The username of the bot that sent the message.

400.description: Bad Request - The request was invalid or cannot be served.

401.description: Unauthorized - The request requires user authentication.

429.description: Too Many Requests - The user has sent too many requests in a given amount of time.

500.description: Internal Server Error - The server has encountered a situation it does not know how to handle.

post.summary: Send a message to a specific Slack channel.
post.description: The messageChannel function allows sending a text message to a specified Slack channel using the Microfox Slack Client. It takes the channel ID and message text as input and returns details about the sent message, including its timestamp and channel information.

body.description: Body of the messageChannel sls call

items.description: The ID of the channel to send the message to.
The text of the message to be sent.

constructorName.description: Name of the constructor to use.

ok.description: true if the request was successful.

channel.description: The ID of the channel where the message was posted.

message.description: An object containing the details of the sent message.

bot_id.description: The ID of the bot that sent the message.

username.description: The username of the bot that sent the message.

post.summary: Sets a reminder for a Slack user.
post.description: The setReminder function allows setting a reminder for a specified Slack user. It takes the user ID, reminder text, and time as inputs, and returns the details of the created reminder. This function interacts with the Slack API to schedule and manage user reminders.

body.description: Body of the setReminder sls call

items.description: The ID of the user to set the reminder for.
The text of the reminder.
A string describing when the reminder should fire (e.g., "in 5 minutes", "at 10:30am", or a Unix timestamp).

constructorName.description: Name of the constructor to use.

ok.description: true if the request was successful.

reminder.description: An object containing the details of the created reminder.

creator.description: The ID of the user who created the reminder.

user.description: The ID of the user the reminder is for.

time.description: The timestamp of when the reminder will fire.

complete_ts.description: The timestamp of when the reminder was completed.

400.description: Bad Request - The request was invalid or cannot be served.

401.description: Unauthorized - The request requires user authentication.

429.description: Too Many Requests - The user has sent too many requests in a given amount of time.

500.description: Internal Server Error - The server has encountered a situation it does not know how to handle.

post.summary: Creates a new public or private channel in Slack.
post.description: The createChannel function allows users to create a new channel in Slack, which can be either public or private. It takes the channel name as a required parameter and an optional boolean to specify if the channel should be private. The function returns a conversation object containing detailed information about the newly created channel.

body.description: Body of the createChannel sls call

items.description: The name of the channel to create.
Whether the channel should be private. Defaults to false.

constructorName.description: Name of the constructor to use.

name.description: The name of the channel-like thing.

is_channel.description: Indicates whether a conversation is a channel.

is_group.description: Means the channel is a private channel created before March 2021.

is_im.description: Means the conversation is a direct message between two distinguished individuals or a user and a bot.

is_mpim.description: Represents an unnamed private conversation between multiple users.

is_private.description: Means the conversation is privileged between two or more members.

created.description: Timestamp of when the conversation was created.

creator.description: The ID of the member that created this conversation.

is_general.description: Means the channel is the workspace's "general" discussion channel.

unlinked.description: The number of members that have been removed from the channel.

name_normalized.description: The channel name, but with any special characters replaced.

is_shared.description: Indicates whether a conversation is part of a Shared Channel.

is_ext_shared.description: Indicates whether a conversation is part of a Shared Channel with a remote organization.

is_org_shared.description: Indicates whether this shared channel is shared between Enterprise Grid workspaces within the same organization.

pending_shared.description: A list of team IDs that have been invited to the channel but have not yet joined.

is_pending_ext_shared.description: Means the conversation is ready to become an is_ext_shared channel, but needs some kind of approval or sign off first.

is_member.description: Indicates whether the user, bot user or Slack app is a member of the conversation.

topic.description: Provides information about the channel topic.

purpose.description: Provides information about the channel purpose.

previous_names.description: A list of previous names for the channel.

num_members.description: The number of members in the conversation.

post.summary: Add a reaction to a Slack message.
post.description: The reactMessage function allows adding an emoji reaction to a specific message in a Slack channel. It requires the channel ID, message timestamp, and the name of the emoji to use as the reaction. This function is useful for programmatically interacting with Slack messages and providing quick feedback or responses.

body.description: Body of the reactMessage sls call

items.description: The ID of the channel where the message is.
The timestamp of the message to react to.
The name of the emoji to use for the reaction (e.g., 'tada', 'thumbsup').

constructorName.description: Name of the constructor to use.

ok.description: true if the request was successful.

error.description: Error message describing the issue with the request.

404.description: Not Found - Channel or message not found

error.description: Specific error indicating what resource was not found.

429.description: Too Many Requests - Rate limit exceeded

error.description: Error indicating that the rate limit has been exceeded.
Error message describing the internal server error.

post.summary: Retrieves detailed information about a specific Slack user.
post.description: The getUserInfo function fetches comprehensive details about a Slack user using their unique user ID. It returns a user object containing various attributes such as profile information, team details, user status, and role-specific flags. This function is useful for obtaining up-to-date user data within a Slack workspace.

body.description: Body of the getUserInfo sls call

items.name: userId
items.description: The ID of the user to get information for.

constructorName.description: Name of the constructor to use.

team_id.description: The ID of the team the user belongs to.

deleted.description: true if the user has been deleted.

color.description: A hexadecimal color code that is used to color the user's name in Slack clients.

tz_label.description: A human-readable string for the user's timezone.

tz_offset.description: The user's timezone offset in seconds.

profile.description: A profile object containing more details about the user.

avatar_hash.description: A hash of the user's avatar image.

image_original.description: The URL of the user's original-sized profile image.

image_24.description: The URL of the user's 24x24 profile image.

image_32.description: The URL of the user's 32x32 profile image.

image_48.description: The URL of the user's 48x48 profile image.

image_72.description: The URL of the user's 72x72 profile image.

image_192.description: The URL of the user's 192x192 profile image.

image_512.description: The URL of the user's 512x512 profile image.

team.description: The ID of the team the user belongs to.

is_admin.description: true if the user is an admin.

is_owner.description: true if the user is an owner.

is_primary_owner.description: true if the user is the primary owner.

is_restricted.description: true if the user is a restricted user (single-channel guest).

is_ultra_restricted.description: true if the user is an ultra-restricted user (multi-channel guest).

is_bot.description: true if the user is a bot.

updated.description: A timestamp of when the user's profile was last updated.

is_app_user.description: true if the user is an app user.

has_2fa.description: true if the user has two-factor authentication enabled.

400.description: Bad Request - The server cannot process the request due to a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

error.description: Error message describing the bad request.

404.description: Not Found - The specified user ID does not exist.

error.description: Error message indicating that the user was not found.

500.description: Internal Server Error - The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

error.description: Error message describing the server error.

post.summary: Send a threaded reply to a message in a Slack channel.
post.description: The replyMessage function allows sending a reply to a specific message in a Slack channel, creating or continuing a thread. It takes the channel ID, the timestamp of the message to reply to, and the text of the reply as parameters. The function returns details about the sent message, including its timestamp and channel.

body.description: Body of the replyMessage sls call

items.description: The ID of the channel where the message is.
The timestamp of the message to reply to, which identifies the thread.
The text of the reply.

constructorName.description: Name of the constructor to use.

ok.description: true if the request was successful.

channel.description: The ID of the channel where the message was posted.

message.description: An object containing the details of the sent message.

bot_id.description: The ID of the bot that sent the message.

username.description: The username of the bot that sent the message.

404.description: Not Found - Channel or message not found

post.summary: Invites a user to a Slack channel.
post.description: The addUserToChannel function adds a specified user to a given Slack channel. It takes the channel ID and user ID as parameters and returns a response object containing the result of the API call, including details about the channel.

body.description: Body of the addUserToChannel sls call

items.description: The ID of the channel to invite the user to.
The ID of the user to invite.

constructorName.description: Name of the constructor to use.

ok.description: true if the request was successful.

channel.description: A conversation object with details on the channel.

name.description: The name of the channel-like thing.

is_channel.description: Indicates whether a conversation is a channel.

is_group.description: Means the channel is a private channel created before March 2021.

is_im.description: Means the conversation is a direct message between two distinguished individuals or a user and a bot.

is_mpim.description: Represents an unnamed private conversation between multiple users.

is_private.description: Means the conversation is privileged between two or more members.

created.description: Timestamp of when the conversation was created.

creator.description: The ID of the member that created this conversation.

is_general.description: Means the channel is the workspace's "general" discussion channel.

unlinked.description: The number of members that have been removed from the channel.

name_normalized.description: The channel name, but with any special characters replaced.

is_shared.description: Indicates whether a conversation is part of a Shared Channel.

is_ext_shared.description: Indicates whether a conversation is part of a Shared Channel with a remote organization.

is_org_shared.description: Indicates whether this shared channel is shared between Enterprise Grid workspaces within the same organization.

pending_shared.description: A list of team IDs that have been invited to the channel but have not yet joined.

is_pending_ext_shared.description: Means the conversation is ready to become an is_ext_shared channel, but needs some kind of approval or sign off first.

is_member.description: Indicates whether the user, bot user or Slack app is a member of the conversation.

topic.description: Provides information about the channel topic.

purpose.description: Provides information about the channel purpose.

previous_names.description: A list of previous names for the channel.

num_members.description: The number of members in the conversation.

404.description: Not Found - Channel or user not found

post.summary: Removes a user from a Slack channel.
post.description: This function removes a specified user from a given Slack channel. It takes the channel ID and user ID as parameters and returns a response indicating whether the operation was successful. This method is useful for managing channel membership programmatically.

body.description: Body of the removeUserFromChannel sls call

items.description: The ID of the channel to remove the user from.
The ID of the user to remove.

constructorName.description: Name of the constructor to use.

ok.description: Indicates if the request was successful.

error.description: Error message describing the issue.

403.description: Forbidden - Not authorized to remove user from channel

404.description: Not Found - Channel or user not found

error.description: Internal server error message.

post.summary: Upload a file to a Slack channel.
post.description: The sendFile function allows users to upload a file to a specified Slack channel. It takes the channel ID, file content, filename, and an optional title as parameters. The function returns a detailed file object containing information about the uploaded file.

body.description: Body of the sendFile sls call

items.description: The ID of the channel to upload the file to. Can be a comma-separated list.
A buffer containing the file content.
The name of the file.
A title for the file.

constructorName.description: Name of the constructor to use.

401.description: Unauthorized - Invalid or missing authentication token

403.description: Forbidden - Not allowed to upload file to the specified channel

413.description: Payload Too Large - File size exceeds the maximum allowed size

post.summary: Retrieves detailed information about a specific file in Slack.
post.description: The getFileInfo function fetches comprehensive metadata for a given file in Slack using its unique file ID. It returns a rich file object containing various attributes such as file properties, sharing details, and associated metadata. This function is essential for applications that need to access or display detailed file information within the Slack ecosystem.

body.description: Body of the getFileInfo sls call

items.description: The ID of the file to get information for.

constructorName.description: Name of the constructor to use.

id.description: The ID of the file object.

created.description: A Unix timestamp representing when the file was created.

timestamp.description: A deprecated property that is provided only for backwards compatibility with older clients.

name.description: Name of the file; may be null for unnamed files.

pretty_type.description: A human-readable version of the type.

user.description: The ID of the user who created the object.

editable.description: Indicates that files are stored in editable mode.

is_external.description: Indicates whether the master copy of a file is stored within the system or not.

external_type.description: Indicates what kind of external file it is, e.g. 'dropbox' or 'gdoc'.

is_public.description: true if the file is public.

public_url_shared.description: true if the file's public URL has been shared.

url_private.description: A URL to the file contents. This requires an authorization header to access.

permalink.description: A URL to a page for the file containing details, comments and a download link.

channels.description: Contains the IDs of any channels into which the file is currently shared.

groups.description: Contains the IDs of any private groups into which the file is currently shared.

ims.description: Contains the IDs of any IM channels into which the file is currently shared.

comments_count.description: The number of comments on the file.

400.description: Bad Request - The server cannot process the request due to a client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, invalid file ID)

404.description: Not Found - The specified file ID does not exist

500.description: Internal Server Error - The server has encountered a situation it doesn't know how to handle
